730899f-b.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaways - Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.]
730899f-b.text:
Marine Parkway Bridge: A set of three views in different directions of the newly constructed causeway that links the Rockways with Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn. No's. 1 and 2 are from a vantage point on Barren Island, Rockway, while No. 3 is towards the latter. Note the former Slips on both sides of this Jamaica Bay Inlet, from which Municipal Ferries steamed, carrying traffic that now uses the Bridge.
July 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Not a Dry Mount Item.

730900f-c.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaways - Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.]
730900f-c.text:
(1 & 2)
Marine Parkway Bridge, from the foot of Flatbush Ave. to the Rockaways, as seen from Barren Island. This is a set of two views.
July 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, another view.
July 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

730901f-a.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaways - Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.]
730901f-a.text:
Marine Parkway Bridge: A set of three views, showing the bridge connecting the Rockaways with Brooklyn via Flatbush Ave. Also seen are the former ferry slips, now obsolete, which formerly
carried the traffic that now uses the bridge.
July 24, 1937
Views 1,2 and 3
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

730897f.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaway Inlet between Brooklyn and Rockaway.]
730897f.text:
crosses Rockaway Inlet bet Brooklyn and Rockaway

Marine Parkway Bridge. 1937.  A vertical lift bridge providing a clearance of 55' in the down position, and 150' in the raised position. The bridge crosses Rockaway inlet between Brooklyn and Rockaway.

730898f.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaway Inlet between Brooklyn and Rockaway.]

730902f-b.text:
